sense.name: two_winged insect, member of Diptera order
sense.examples: A fly crawled along the edge of the windowsill. Mary covered the food at the picnic to protect it from flies. There are several different species of biting fly.

sense.name: the opening flap of a tent
sense.examples: We tied the fly back to let a breeze into the tent. The fly of John's new tent has a plastic window panel.

sense.name: the opening in the front of a pair of pants
sense.examples: Bob discreetly told Tom that his fly was open. John prefers jeans with button-up flies to those with zippers.

sense.name: a baseball whose trajectory goes high in the air
sense.examples: The batter popped a fly to right which was caught to retire the side. It's a deep fly going back to the wall, and it's gone!

sense.name: a fishing lure that looks like an insect
sense.examples: The tackle shop had beautiful fly lures behind a glass case. John's grandfather taught him how to make a fly to catch trout.

sense.name: an infestation of a plant or animal with an insect species
sense.commentary: FLY[+state][+infestation][+with_species][+insect][+on_plant_or_animal] Note: occurs in the singular, as a generic reference to the species.
sense.examples: The cattle were being treated for warble fly.

sense.name: the space above the stage in a theater
sense.commentary: FLY[+location][+spatial][+above_stage][+in_theater] Note: occurs only in the plural 'the flies'
sense.examples: The dancer was carried across the flies on very thin wires.
